citations.narrative:
On October 21, 2024, a 2.5-year-old male Pere David’s deer was found dead in the lake near a bubbler. An electrical line
was found to be wrapped around the front portion of the neck and once around the antler of the deer. The corresponding
necropsy report was submitted to the facility by the pathology lab on January 31, 2025. The report states the death was
attributed to “acute pulmonary shock likely due to trauma or drowning”. It further notes that this deer was otherwise in
“excellent nutritional status with no underlying chronic disease processes”. Given that this species is known to be a
semiaquatic animal, swims well, and spends long periods of time standing in water up to its shoulders, an incident of
drowning would be unusual in an otherwise healthy animal. Entanglement in the electrical cord likely caused this animal to
struggle in the water and not swim normally, resulting in the death of this animal. The facility must ensure outdoor housing
areas are constructed in a manner to protect animals from injury.
Correct by: July 17, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Mark Sanderbeck, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
On October 21, 2024, a 2.5-year-old male Pere David’s deer was found dead in the lake near a bubbler. An electrical line 
was found to be wrapped around the front portion of the neck and once around the antler of the deer. The corresponding 
necropsy report was submitted to the facility by the pathology lab on January 31, 2025. The report states the death was 
attributed to “acute pulmonary shock likely due to trauma or drowning”. It further notes that this deer was otherwise in 
“excellent nutritional status with no underlying chronic disease processes”. Given that this species is known to be a 
semiaquatic animal, swims well, and spends long periods of time standing in water up to its shoulders, an incident of 
drowning would be unusual in an otherwise healthy animal. Entanglement in the electrical cord likely caused this animal to 
struggle in the water and not swim normally, resulting in the death of this animal. The facility must ensure outdoor housing 
areas are constructed in a manner to protect animals from injury.  
Correct by: July 17, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Mark Sanderbeck, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

species.common: AFRICAN HUNTING DOG / AFRICAN WILD DOG
